articles.description: Latest football news and reaction as Chelsea's Cole Palmer scores four in a 6-0 win against Everton at Stamford Bridge, plus Champions League build-up and news conferences to come throughout the day.
articles.title: Reaction as Chelsea thrash Everton, plus Champions League build-up & football latest

articles.description: Paris will welcome the world this summer, but France's distinctive relationship with religion means its own Olympic athletes will have a different dress code.
articles.title: Paris 2024: The controversial hijab ban at sport's biggest party

articles.description: Chelsea boss Mauricio Pochettino says he was "so upset" about the dispute over who would take the penalty in their 6-0 win over Everton and warns his players not to do it again.
articles.title: Pochettino 'can't accept' Chelsea penalty squabble

articles.description: The college women's basketball sensation has driven massive interest into the sport.
articles.title: Caitlin Clark selected No 1 by Indiana Fever in WNBA draft

articles.description: The BBC's Sporting Witness podcast meets Nicky Salapu, who played in the heaviest defeat in international football.
articles.title: The keeper who conceded 31 goals in a game

articles.description: BBC Sport's F1 correspondent Andrew Benson answers your questions before this weekend's Chinese Grand Prix.
articles.title: F1 Q&A: Andrew Benson answers your questions before Chinese Grand Prix

articles.description: Former Australia batter Michael Slater is refused bail and remanded in custody over domestic violence charges.
articles.title: Slater refused bail on domestic violence charges

articles.description: England all-rounder Nat Sciver-Brunt and Australia captain Pat Cummins are named as the leading cricketers in the world by Wisden.
articles.title: Sciver-Brunt & Cummins named leading cricketers

articles.description: The British and Irish Lions hope "levelling up" money can spread representation on first women's tour.
articles.title: £3m fund aims to ensure Lions are not just England

articles.description: Scottie Scheffler confirmed himself as the best golfer on the planet with Sunday's Masters victory but Ludvig Aberg's performance should not go unnoticed, writes Iain Carter.
articles.title: Masters 2024: Scottie Scheffler's win at Augusta and Ludvig Aberg's runner-up to be cherished
